did.unittitle: New-York Historical Society Executive Office records

physdesc.extent: in 165 document boxes and and 2 oversize folders

did.abstract: The record group includes the correspondence and subject files of N-YHS's President and Chief Executive Officers, beginning with the administration of James B. Bell in 1982-1988. The record group is restricted, with records opened 35 years after the departure of a Chief Executive Officer. During the period of restriction, the records may be used only by, or with the permission of, the current President and Chief Executive Officer or her designee.

accruals.head: Accruals Note
accruals.p: The record group will continue to accrue additional material received over time from the Office of the President and Chief Executive Officer.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: The record group is organized in the following series:
Series I. James B. Bell Administration (RESTRICTED until 2024)
Series II. Executive Office General Correspondence (RESTRICTED until 2030)
Series III. Barbara Knowles Debs and Subsequent Interim Administrations (RESTRICTED until 2030)
Series IV. Betsy Gotbaum and Kenneth Jackson Administrations (RESTRICTED until 2039)

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: N-YHS restricts Executive Office files for 35 years following the departure of a President and Chief Executive Officer. The Executive Office record group begins with the James B. Bell leadership years (1982-1988), so the series that includes those records are restricted until 2024. Other series holding the records of Bell's successors will be opened in subsequent years. While the restriction applies, these records may be used only by, or with the permission of, the President and Chief Executive Officer or her designee.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to quote from this collection in a publication must be requested and granted in writing. Send permission requests, citing the name of the collection from which you wish to quote to: Manuscript Curator, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This record group should be cited as New-York Historical Society Executive Ofice records (NYHS-RG 22), The New-York Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the New-York Historical Society archives. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the New-York Historical Society Archives (NYHSRG Archives). Other record groups that are processed and available to researchers and are especially related to the New-York Historical Society Executive Office records (NYHS-RG 22) are as follows:

For the records of the N-YHS executive (referred to as "Director" from the late 1930s until 1989, and as "Librarian" prior to the late 1930s) prior to James B. Bell's administration (1982-1988), see New-York Historical Society General Correspondence (NYHS-RG 2).

There is a close correlation between the Executive Office records and the Board of Trustee record group. The Board records are accessible on the same basis as the Executive Office records, meaning Board records are open through 1982. See New-York Historical Society Board of Trustees Records (NYHS-RG 18).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The record group includes the correspondence and subject files of N-YHS's President and Chief Executive Officers, beginning with the administration of James B. Bell (the position was then still referred to as Director) in 1982-1988. The record group is currently restricted (see Access Restrictions note).
